Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redwrangler
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant and polite staff, hotel is a little worn but clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet is great with hot and cold offerings including eggs and waffles. Hotel is very close to the Longwood area with Boston's important hospitals including Brigham & Womens, Childrens, and Dana Farber. A free shuttle service is offered to hospitals and to the airport. If you need a place to stay during a loved one's hospitalization or are coming to Boston for treatment, this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Children's Hospital visit”
Reviews.Author: PJB413
Reviews.Content: For the price I was satified with what was offered. They had a shallow pool which delighted my son and his friends. Bed was comfortable and clean. Breakfast and Dinner buffett was included in the hotel price. Parking was extra but this is Boston after all and you pay premium for parking just about everwhere in that city. I did have a problem with the shuttle leaving us stranded at the New England Aquarium for 1.5 Hours after dark. Also my room smelled moldy and the toilet flooded the bathroom at 5 AM. The flooding was taken care of immediately but not very convenient at 5 AM.

Reviews.Title: “VERY UNHELPFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: allie p
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as an employee of another Hilton property and I was very dissatisfied. As a nother Hilton employee, the service of the front desk and housekeeping was not up to standards. I left a backpack in the room, and have called the hotel on multiple occasions and left message for the lost and found department......to no success, I have not heard back and still am without my backpack. I am not happy about this and will not ever be staying at this property again. Nor will I recommend it to friends, family, or other employees of my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable Comfort”
Reviews.Author: cococantada
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston this time to help our daughter, who had been admitted to Boston Medical Center for a stroke. She had been found twelve hours later by a friend. We made reservations at the Hampton Inn Crosstown, which is across the street from the hospital and we could walk between the two early in the morning or later at night after visitor hours were over. Although there are a group of homeless people occasionally, there are also many young student doctors walking the streets to and from the medical center. I believe a homeless shelter is nearby. We were never bothered by any of the homeless people either. There is a CVS pharmacy up two blocks from the hotel's parking area to the north, so this was convenient for snacks and medical needs. The best thing about this hotel was that the manager is sensitive to the needs of its guests who have family members staying at the hospital with life-threatening illnesses. He offered dinners to the hotel guests, as well as the hotel having the policy of including free hot breakfasts that were the best I've ever had at a Hampton Inn or other hotel of the same category. There was always hot chocolate, coffee, tea, and warm chocolate chip cookies to soothe our weary bodies after a particularly rough day at the hospital. These little touches meant the world to us. We are so very appreciative of this hotel manager offering its guests a hot meal in the evenings. I loved the themes, too. One night it would be Chinese food, the next night, Mexican fare, or Italian goodies. We looked forward to the meals each night before hurrying off back to the hospital. We also got the medical group rate since we were there because our daughter was in the hospital. The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfy, although the pillows were a tad too firm for me. I never had trouble sleeping despite the pain in my heart over what happened to our daughter. The bathrooms were also well equipped and very clean. The front desk staff were very accommodating when we had to extend our stay several times while our daughter recovered in the hospital. The front lobby is bright and spacious, and there is an airport shuttle that is quite expedient. Just call them and despite traffic, they are there quick because they use a special road for shuttles to avoid the notorious traffic at rush hour. There is a newly remodeled computer room and two elevators that actually work. The only drawback at staying close to any hospital is that you may hear ambulance sirens in the middle of the night occasionally. But with a sound conditioner or earplugs, plus the sound of the room heater, it's less noticeable. Would we stay there again if needed? You bet! In a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, neighborhood not great”
Reviews.Author: solotraveler21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms were nice. Move it about 2 miles into the city and there would be no complaints whatsoever. The walk to the T (metro) is scary. I didn't feel very safe at night when I came back to the hotel. It's just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1991
Reviews.Content: We opted to stay here, as it was so much cheaper than a lot of the other hotels we searched. the reason being it is slightly further away from the sights. But the hotel ran a free shuttle bus service into the main areas, so it really didnt make any difference. The rooms here, are huge. you have a mini kitchen, complete with microwave, fridge and sink. The room, also have large work desks, a large sitting area, and a very comfy large bed. The area has a chemist, pizza place, a dunkin doughnuts, and if you are prepared for a big of a walk. there is a shopping complex, with old navy, best buy, olive garden and others about a mile or two up the road. i would recommend, as the rooms were clean, the breakfast was lovely, the staff were helpful. the hotel also serves hot drinks in the lobby all day. there is a tuck shop aswell as a resturant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: kqs5041
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel online a couple of days before new years eve. Rate was very good since I was booking so close to the date. We Took the train into ruggles station and decided to walk the mile or so to the hotel...bad idea. The neighborhood is not pretty. Very sketchy, dark, and somewhat dangerous. But, it's not the hotels fault that they are located there. Once we arrived, we were greeted warmly by staff and check in was painless. The room was clean and comfortable. There was some noise from the sirens going to and from the hospital, but once again, one can't blame the hotel. When we asked them to call a cab, one woman was very rude, but a nice man (he looked like a manager) jumped in and called one for us. Overall, I was happy, but the neighborhood deters me from going back.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SophieZ118
Reviews.Content: The staff is really nice. The rooms are clean and smells so good when you enter. A lot of towels, something I like. Such a huuuuge bed (King)! The fan worked very well. BUT The location is pretty bad. You need to walk a bit long to find the T (in the cold, not so nice). And it's next to the Boston Medical Center, so a lot of noise. If you're tired, it won't bother you at all. And the neighborhood is very poor and creepy sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hampton Inn Property but Bad Location & Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Salmantino6884
Reviews.Content: Typically stay at this Hampton Inn when the rates are reasonable (especially compared to other hotels in the city); however, this is my last time staying here. The property, rooms and typical Hampton qualities were all fine. Nothing to write home about but comfort level was there... The location and service made me not want to return. This hotel is adjacent to Boston Medical Center...I'm not sure if it is a busy season or what but the ambulance/police/fire sirens are non-stop... all through the night/morning. If you need a 5 AM alarm... stay here. Typically I request a high floor but my arrival wasn't until 11 PM and I received a room on the 3rd floor... terrible. Additionally, the Wireless Internet wasn't working. When I called to ask if they would reset the router they said that it was my computer issue. Next, some random man knocked on my door without my request and offered to help against my protest. His suggestion was to restart the computer (thanks, because I didn't already try that). When that didn't work he gave me a number to call... so I can sit on hold and talk to your service tech. No, thanks. Never again...

Reviews.Title: “Cheers Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Angela D
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 Adults & 2 Children had 2 nights at this Hotel. We arrived around 7.15pm, & were greeted professionally. The room was clean & comfortable, We were very hungry and as we'd missed the complimentary dinner we decided to walk to McDonalds which we could see from the hotel! To be honest it wasn't the safest I've ever felt in a Maccas! I would say this is a good hotel for a short-term stay, and would recommend having the complimentary but basic dinner that the hotel provides.....rather than travelling out to a restaurant! The complimentary breakfast was a bonus as was the free internet acces & free airport shuttle. The Hotel was a bit noisy with sirens going all night but considering we had booked it from Australia and really didn't know where we should or shouldn't book we weren't disappointed with the location or price! That said though, if we were to return we would probably stay closer to Boston Common! We really only had one full day here.....so we walked the "Freedom Trail".....this was a good way to get the know the city in a short time.....and of course no trip to Boston is complete without a beer in the Cheers Bar!

Reviews.Title: “Clean facilities, very hospitable staff!”
Reviews.Author: LRLEWIS
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. I was a little skeptical about staying at this hotel after reading some of the reviews that other guests had posted on Trip Advisor but decided to give it a try. I'm so glad I did. Our room was large and very clean. The bedding and pillows were good quality. The staff was wonderful and helped with anything we needed.We were surprised to find that on top of the Hampton Inn free breakfast they offered fare such as tacos compliments of the manager 5:30-7:00pm. Every night they had something different. We would eat a good lunch and then eat what the Hotel was having that night. Complimentary coffee,tea and hot cocoa were available 24hrs a day. The pool is on the top floor and has great views of the city. It was clean with plenty of towels available.Adjacent to the pool is the gym. Also very nice.The rates are very reasonable for Boston. A couple of things I would point out that were not a problem for me. There are people out in the intersections panhandling at different times. 99% of the mororists ignore them. I didn't see them approach pedestrians. Boston is a large city. Caution should always be used in any large city after dark. The ambulance sirens and traffic noises didn't bother me but that's me. I didn't find the location to be a problem. They have a hospital shuttle as well as an airport shuttle running everyday at various times. Different tour companies stop in everyday as well to pick up guests for duck and sight tours. I will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: DoctorKeo
Reviews.Content: This is the second Hampton Inn we have stayed at â€“ the other in Orlando; and if anything this hotel is better than the Orlando one. Our visit started with their complimentary shuttle from the airport. It was only a short wait for the shuttle. We were greeted by a friendly and helpful check in staff. The room was clean, quite large (even room for a large desk!) with a good sized bathroom. The room tariff included free Internet complimentary breakfast and complimentary dinner (more like snacks Hotdogs, Tacoâ€™s) â€“ which was ideal for us to grab some food after a long day sightseeing. We are unsure whether the dinner snacks were just a one off special offer. We found public transport easy into Boston for sightseeing. At the end we used the complimentary shuttle (about every hour during the day) back to the Logan Airport. My only caveat is the hotel is very near to a Hospital and although the ambulance siren didnâ€™t keep me from sleeping, they are loud passing the hotel. This is the second Hampton Inn we have stayed at â€“ the other in Orlando; and if anything this hotel is better than the Orlando one. Our visit started with their complimentary shuttle from the airport. It was only a short wait for the shuttle. We were greeted by a friendly and helpful check in staff. The room was clean, quite large (even room for a large desk!) with a good sized bathroom. The room tariff included free Internet complimentary breakfast and complimentary dinner (more like snacks Hotdogs, Tacoâ€™s) â€“ which was ideal for us to grab some food after a long day sightseeing. We are unsure whether the dinner snacks were just a one off special offer. We found public transport easy into Boston for sightseeing. The local bus SL1, stop next to the hotel, goes into Harvard, and the SL4 (3 blocks) took into the centre of Boston. We paid $1.25 per person per journey. At the end of our stay we used the complimentary shuttle (about every hour during the day) back to the Logan Airport. My only caveat is the hotel is very near to a Hospital and although the ambulance siren didnâ€™t keep me from sleeping, they are loud passing the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SIRENS A PLENTY”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT F
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune of staying a week here at the end of July 2011. We endured an average of 14 emergency vehicle sirens per night as the hotel is across the street from Boston Medical. It was tough sleeping. There is no restaurant on sight and there is nothing close by. The hotel is a 15 minute walk to the nearest T station in a less than desirable neighborhood. One night we found our room door ajar and with the assistance of a team member, entered. Forunately, nothing was missing, but housekeeping did not insure the our door was closed tightly. I addressed this with the Manager who apologized and said he would mail a "Be My Guest Certificate" to our home since our perepaid rate could not be refunded. We have yet to receive this certificate and Hilton Customer Service has not been at all helpful. The breakfast bar is fantastic. Its the best thing about this hotel. The front desk associates are not helpful and communication is not consistent especially when trying to use their shuttle. I would never recommend anyone stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: AuditMan001
Reviews.Content: Shortly after check-in we learned that the "on premises" bar & grill listed in the hotel information in our room had closed January 1, 2011. We asked the person at the front desk for a nearby place to eat and have a drink or two. She sent us "just a short walk down the street". Not being familiar with the area we set out on foot. There were four of us, another couple, my wife, and me. We walked about 6 of the most dangerous blocks I've ever walked and I've been to more third-world countries than I care to remember. Numerous shady looking characters crossed our path or slowed down as they drove past us. It wouldn't have been so bad if we had not been assured by the person at the front desk that the area was safe, we had read some of the other reviews beforehand. I don't know what kind of neighborhood she (the person at the front desk) grew up in or lives in now, but I don't consider the neighborhood she sent us to as being safe at all. When we got to the establishment we couldn't get waited on so we left. It was very embarrassing to my wife and me as our friends are from overseas and this was their first trip to Boston. Before making our reservations we read that the hotel is out of the way but offers a complimentary shuttle service. This is from their website - "We offer an extensive shuttle service at the Boston Hampton Crosstown Center, and opportunity for you to save on cab fare and parking fees." We booked here because of that statement on their website. It is also in their room information book. Not so - this service stopped January 1, 2011. The shuttle, we were told, only runs to and from the airport. When we were ready to check out, I went downstairs to, as instructed in the hotel information book, to "reserve" our seats on the next shuttle. When asked if I could reserve two seats on the next shuttle I was told "just come down at 10 minutes before the hour". This is not the service and attitude we have come to expect from Hampton Inn & Suites. Please refer to our review of the HI&S at Plymouth, MA. Now THAT's how you run a hotel. We do not recommend this hotel. In addition, as the hotel is located across from a hospital emergency room, don't expect peace and quiet as there are sirens 24/7. An hint to the staff - an occassional smile doesn't cost anything.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most convenient hotel but would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: CM_Visitor
Reviews.Content: Room: Very good. Bathroom with shampoo, conditioner, soap, body lotion, mouthwash, shower hat, make up remover and hairdryer. Plenty of towels including face cloths. Main room â€“ new flat screen television, coffee maker (can use this for just hot water), easy to use heating or cooling unit, window opens just a little, iron/iron board, desk/chair, armchair/footrest, plenty of coat hangers but no safety deposit box. Hotel facilities: Very good. Small air conditioned gym (with water machine), small swimming pool (8 front crawl stokes long), ice machine (free) and cold drinks machine (charge) on each floor, complementary breakfast (some hot food, bagels/toast, cereals, juice, fresh fruit salad (very good) or take away breakfast bag. The breakfast area got very busy but it was possible to use the overflow area in the attached restaurant (this wasnâ€™t open in the evenings). Tea, coffee, hot chocolate available all day and cookies in the evening (these went fast). Two free computer terminals and printers in lobby (can print boarding passes here). Complementary shuttle to and from airport. Location: Not close enough to the centre to pop home for a rest during the day and come out again. No decent places nearby to eat out. Can take the bus 1 or CT1 (express) to Mass Ave metro stop or one stop on to Symphony for the tram/tube line. Other buses also run nearby. A mixed crowd waiting at the bus stop in the mornings although most people at the stop didnâ€™t board the bus. It would take about 20/25 minutes to walk to the Mass Ave metro stop. Although not the best area I couldnâ€™t say I ever felt unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: SandraandKirk
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was reasonably priced and in a good area to get around to everything in Boston. It's across the street from Boston Medical Center. The hotel is very nice and well maintained. The staff is courteous. However, the neighborhood is bad. Lots of vagrants, druggies and deranged people wandering around. The bus and train are nearby but you have to be aware at all times. Nice hotel but we wouldn't stay there again. They advertise a pool but when we went to see it, it was only 3.5 feet deep all around.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: nursetina74
Reviews.Content: I am a diamond HH member, and this hotel was clean and just like the other Hampton Inns I usually stay. The breakfast was good as usual, the staff in the bfst area were very nice.. they kept the place clean. The front desk hostess was so rude. Seemed like she got up on the wrong side of the bed every morning. I won' stay here again because of her. There is a cafe downstairs, but don't be fooled. Its not open. It closed down. The items in the pantry freezer were still in boxes. The business center was not equipped with pens or notepads.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most convenient hotel, but would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tikidream
Reviews.Content: My son and I were looking for a reasonably priced and public transit accessible hotel for our recent stay in Boston. We were on the college hunt as well as site seeing- this hotel was great for us. The rooms are big and clean and the beds are comfortable. Towels ample and bathroom clean and updated. We live in a city, so the street noise didn't bother us. If you are not use to an urban environment this might not be the hotel for you. It is smack in the medical center area so there are sirens. Our room was on the third floor, and we had no problem sleeping, but we're use to this kind of background noise. The T is a long 6 block walk from the hotel. We felt safe and it is a direct route- but much longer than we originally thought. Again, for us this wasn't a problem- but plan about a 10-15 minute walk to the T. The bus stop is right outside. While this hotel wasn't the most convenient hotel in town, the price was right, it wasn't inconvenient. Overall it was safe, clean and staff were friendly. The free airport shuttle and breakfast were also good. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful spot adjacent to Boston Medical Center”
Reviews.Author: realtimeMaine
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Hampton Inn four different nights as we had medical appointments and surgery at Boston Medical Center. It is walking distance to the office and hospital - served breakfast and even dinner to my husband. Gave us an excellent discount for having a patient at the center, and found and sent the clothes we left in the closet. We will be staying there again. It is low key - and much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: happycamper49673
Reviews.Content: After reading all the other reviews, I will say I was really afraid of what this stay would be like. You can't always judge a book by its cover. Although I did hear some noise from the ambulances during the early hours of the morning, but when I heard those it was time to get up any way. My stay was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Love Boston and loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: theraff4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and so new. The rate was great-even the parking was cheap compared to other hotels. Staff was great and the free breakfast was so much better than expected! Heard a little ambulance noise but slept like a dream- even better than when at home. Cons- a little further from areas we were visiting but cabs were cheap when needed and shuttle service at hotel is free! Would totally stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: LuvsTaTravel11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three (3) friends and we enjoyed it very much!! The only thing we would've changed is the location. We were a little creeped out walking back from the "T" station at night. The fact that it was close to the Boston Medical Center didn't bother us at all, no one complained about that! We did hear sirens, but it was never any constant noise and we were able to get a good nights sleep all 7 nights we were there. Free Breakfast: There is a wide variety of options for breakfast! A hot breakfast on one side with sausage, home fries and eggs. Sometimes they switch it up and have bacon and french toast sticks! Then there is your basic bagel, muffin, cereal, fruit, rolls. All excellent choices! The seating area fills quickly but you're allowed to sit in the restaurant just off to the side. Hotel Staff: The staff was EXTREMELY helpful and VERY nice! They never seemed irritated with our questions (and we asked A LOT of questions) and they always greeted us when we came into the lobby. We couldn't have asked for better!! Shuttle Service: The hotel site says to call them and request the shuttle when you reach the airport. We did this and it arrived promptly just 10 minutes later. Thing is 6 others climbed in and there was no longer room for the 4 of us. So we basically called for someone else's shuttle and eneded up waiting an extra half hour for the driver to return. However, when we needed to catch the 5AM shuttle back to airport, we left right at 5 and didn't wait at all! Also, everything we read about this hotel told us that they have a shuttle service to attractions around town. We asked them about this one day and we were told they didn't have services like that! Maid Service: Our beds were made and room cleaned very well every day! Except for the last night we were there, they changed the sheets with dirty ones! There was a massive stain on one side of them. Overall, we had a great experience at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location for Boston Medical Center/other Boston hospitals”
Reviews.Author: 10514traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives deep discounts for families needing to stay visiting someone in the nearby hospitals. Apparently they reserve rooms for such purpose so that even if the Hampton Inn website says they are full, it is worth calling directly for availability. Breakfast is included. Self-parking is only $10 a day and you can come and go as often as you please. The room was spacious, immaculately clean with a very nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “overall great, noise from ambulances a factor”
Reviews.Author: cantraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn was predictably clean and comfortable. Staff were very courteous. It was disappointing to find out that the previously free shuttle to South station was now a paid service. Also it would be important to ask for a quiet room as the noise from ambulance sirens is quite prominent. The hotel is located acroos the street from the Boston medical centre(very convenient for some) as well as close to an EMS/paramedic parking area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Soft Bed, Free Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Shivan_Dragon
Reviews.Content: All the basics are there; Simple check in, very nice and clean room, an excellent night of sleep (I heard no sirens as per other reviews and I am a fairly light sleeper) The free breakfast was nice; nothing over and above but still very nice. Was asked how the meal was when I got up which was also something that made me feel that the staff actually cared about the customers. The one thing I will warn business travelers of; Getting a cab in the morning is a nightmare, I called 10 minutes prior got out front to witness three people diving for a single cab (that was most likely the one I called) all claiming they had been waiting for upwards of 20 - 30 minutes. I ended up having to call a car service which took 30 minutes to arrive only to find that only two cabs showed up during that period.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: daniella_moll
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed here at the end of May to visit family. The rooms were comfortable and clean, though I did find it surprising that there was no in-room safe. The hotel was quiet (though you did sometimes hear the sirens from the nearby hospitals at night - but not a huge bother) and the staff was very friendly and helpful. You definitely need a car to get around since the closest T stop is several city blocks away, but there's an Enterprise that shares the parking garage with them, so pretty convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: tzzInnisfil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, the rooms are beautiful, the complimentary breakfast was the best, the front desk staff was the most helpful and the maid service was exceptional! Very friendly, very, very well priced! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “refreshing stay”
Reviews.Author: Nina8
Reviews.Content: The hotel property and rooms were very well kept. The staff were friendly. However, there is no restaurant on-site as with most Hampton-Inns. There are diners and restaurants in short driving distance. Stayed there for business. Drop off your luggage before you park your vehicle. Very comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Marklet69
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston to see the Red Sox and Yankee game. We asked three weeks before we went if there was a shuttle to Fenway, we were told there was. We asked if they had a restaurant at the hotel, we were told there was. We asked if we could checkin before noon becasue we were going to the game, we were told we could. When we arrived (around 12:00 noon) we couldn't checkin. The shuttle to the game was "seasonal" and wasn't available. The restaurant (Rubi's) has closed permantly! I wonder why? Customer service was very unhelpful when looking for a place to eat, we had to settle with a bottle of wine, and we bought a pizza down the road. The walls are paper thin, and don't expect the vending machines to work, the one on the 6th floor didn't. The room was ok, our neighbor had an issue, their door didn't lock! The breakfast was ok, but there wasn't enough tables for everyone to sit. The hotel is located in the middle of no where.

Reviews.Title: “A very practical option for college visits”
Reviews.Author: trixy007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites because it had a convenient location for visiting colleges in the Boston area. The best part was they have a complimentary shuttle that picked us up from the airport and then took us to Northeastern and Boston Univ. The afternoon driver named Greg was the nicest ever and even drove us to restaurants in North End and Newberry street for dinner. The rest of the time we took cabs in order to get us to Tufts on time for our tour. The staff at the hotel was very nice and the breakfast made it so easy for us to start our busy days. There are several restaurants and a CVS Pharmacy within walking distance. We went to Equator, a Thai restaurant that was great. The only drawback is that the rooms were a bit small and because it's near the hospital there are ambulance sirens going all the time. Bring ear plugs. I would stay here again for business but for pleasure I'd stay in Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Makes business travel easy”
Reviews.Author: LMD24
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for work - and I thought I'd finally write a review for the Hampton Inn. It stands out for a lot of the reasons a good hotel should (clean, nice staff, good location). What sets this hotel apart from the others are the rooms. They're just nice and luxurious - think Pottery Barn catalog - and it makes being away from home for business feel a bit like a vacation. Which is hard to do.

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: tespaulding1
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in Boston at this hotel. Rooms, were nicely appointed, clean, comfortable and in a great location. Parking was conveniently located across the street in a garage. A large group of school children were checking in just in front of us, I was concerned that it might be noisy, and it was not. Breakfast was busy in the morning, but well stocked and supplied for the crowd that was there. All in all a great that I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Millie83
Reviews.Content: I just wanted something affordable and in a central location but this hotel's free shuttle bus and free breakfast were an awesome bonus. The shuttle bus drivers were really friendly and I saw the GM at breakfast around 7am, then still on property about 6pm - hard worker! I wouldn't describe the front desk people as charming or even particularly helpful, but hey, it's a cheap hotel and I wasn't there for an ego stroke. Probably the only warning I have is that the hotel was full of old people (due to nearby medical centre) who complain about any petty thing. Having to listen to them on the shuttle bus, at breakfast, while waiting in the lobby etc gets seriously tiresome.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: longbeaches
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for convenience for important meeting. Had early flight and arranged to go to the airport on the 5am shuttle included with the hotel stay. The driver failed to show up but the worst of all was the rudeness of the receptionist who made no eye contact and ignored our questions. Would never stay with this chain agan

Reviews.Title: “FRONT DESK WORKER TRACY -- IS VERY RUDE.”
Reviews.Author: biglee139
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Boston, MA and had a very bad experience with the front desk worker Tracy --. She is very rude. Whenever we walk in or out of the Hotel she looks at us with very unpleasant and angry expressions. Not sure if it were a bad week for her but she didn't say "hi" or welcome to the Hampton Inn at all. We even made an attempt to speak and still nothing.....This already made us feel very uncomfortable especially due to the fact that we were booked to stay for one week. When we went to the desk to make purchases the money was thrown on the table and we were ignored and put on hold for what appeared to be personal phone calls. SHE MADE OUR HOTEL STAY UNCOMFORTABLE.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite What They Make It Out To Be.”
Reviews.Author: nhsoprano
Reviews.Content: Called ahead to see if they had a restaurant because that was one of our highest priorities and they said they did, so we booked our stay. When we arrived they informed us that the restaurant had been shut down for weeks. To late to move on so we decided to stay and make the best of it. Next disappointment came while unloading our vehicle through the snow banks (because I guess it's more important to park the Hotel Van in front of the entrance). On departure another van was parked in front of the entrance this time with a driver, when asked to move forward so we could load our vehicle he just looked disgusted at me and reluctantly moved forward about 10 feet. The rooms are clean but lack any significant perks (old style tv's, no refrigerator, etc ). The location, although noisy due to the medical center next door is perfect for travelers looking to be within walking distance of Boston,s best night life, But I would not recommend staying here due to their lack of interest for total customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “"Never stay here, worst Hampton Inn, worst Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: tamara2323
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at this hotel, situated next to a downtown emergency room... good luck sleeping. not a good part f town or easy to get around. Good luck getting the hotel shuttle. i found the service so disrespectful ad rude even from managment. The front desk staff refuse to talk to you and give one word anwers. The shuttle service lies and claims they cannot transport you to certain areas. We were completley turned off this hotel as we are seen as a inconvience by being there. The main lady at the front desk i beleive her name starts with D, was obnoxious and unfriendly. The entire staff had an attitude. Nothing like what the Hampton inn stands for. extremley dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: BigEast55
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal, got upgraded to a suite. Was really large with ample space for everything. Free Wi-Fi was very nice, free business center with printer was also a huge plus. The front desk was very helpful. Wasn't the most comfortable bed in the entire world, but it wasn't bad either. Location was great if you are going to Boston Medical Center or the Brigham and Women's Administrative Center, but really not much around in the terms of food or other things. Still highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “New and good location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Masahisa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close from the airport, it was just 10 mins away by free shuttle bus. Although the nearest subway station is about 15 mins walk. As the hotels in downtown is too expensive for me, I thought this hotel is an ideal place to stay in Boston, because I dont mind walking 15 mins to the subway station. The area is quiet and I did not see any restaurants nearby. I probably saw a pub on the way from the hotel to the subway station. The hotel seemed very new and the room was clean and cozy. The lobby was spacious and nice. Other than that, the hotel is just like any other Hampton Inn hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, perfect location next to Boston Medical Center (BU)”
Reviews.Author: sitzmanna
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. Nice rooms, clean, quiet, great location. Price was a little high in my book, but maybe not for Boston, I didn't comparison shop because I cared more about convenience. Factoring in a good breakfast (varied hot & cold options), saving on taxis by taking the shuttle, & proximity to the hospital, it was a great deal for me. Used the airport shuttle to/from...approx 20 minutes wait saved me $20+ each time, which I thought was a fair trade-off.

Reviews.Title: “They lie about shuttle service-plan other transportation!”
Reviews.Author: DineRight4
Reviews.Content: Their "free" shuttle service is a joke, don't count on it. Plan to spend your money on taxi's if you really need to be someplace and don't want to wait foreever. (Taxi's still easier/cheaper than renting a car and trying to park.) Twice, we were told "the shuttle will be there at x:15. Well, 45 minutes later and 1 hour and 10 minutes AFTER we called for the airport shuttle, we were still waiting. My colleague also waited OVER an hour at the airport, and the hotel finally said, "get a taxi and we'll pay for it," which they did- but after she stood in the cold for an hour waiting for the shuttle that they kept promising. One night, was told there would be an airport shuttle that could drop us off at the convention center - I was told it would "leave at 6." Well, 6 pm, no shuttle. They called and said "10 minutes, he'll be here." 6:15, still no shuttle. We finally called for a taxi, and it was there by 6:20 (still no shuttle) and we ended up late to our meeting and paid our own taxi fare. The front desk staff is the LEAST friendly of any Hampton Inn I've ever stayed at (okay, I admit, some of theri staff is GREAT, but seems half are miserable.) The room is fine, clean, we have an upper floor room, so not much siren noise (we are next door to an ER after all) and happy with our room. Didn't think much of the prostitutes (at least they appeared to be such to me and my husband) in the bar or the music, but, I guess it's what the locals prefer. NOT a nice neighborhood, but, we stayed for the rate, and not to be walking around the area at night anyway. I'd recommend the hotel anyway, but with the caveat of "don't trust them regarding the shuttle service." Oh, by the way, the shuttle drivers were great guys, and we did take the shuttle one night, with about 12 other people, but took over 30 minutes to get to our destination - would have been 10 minutes by taxi. So, just don't make plans based on their "supposed" shuttle service. Breakfast is standard Hampton Inn artificially flavored, highly processed fare. Exactly the same as every other Hampton we've stayed at. But, there is some fresh frut (unaldulterated with artificial preservatives) and the coffee's good! If you don't mind refined wheat, processed oatmeal, yogurt with a bunch of crap in it and reheated eggs and sausage, you'll love their free breakfast. I just with there was more "real" -unprocessed food to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay - fabulous breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Awful_Kgp
Reviews.Content: close to the boston station (making trip to new york easy) .breakfast was varied and had a large selection which we thoroughly enjoyed.free internet facility was very useful and for keeping passports/valuables safe lockers were avaiable at the reception.luggage carrying trolley was big and easy to handle

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Hammo123
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why other reviewers have a problem with this hotel. Firstly, it's located just out of the center of Boston (15 minute walk), however there is a close subway stop, about 2 minutes walk from the hotel. The foyer is well staffed and clean. The only negative I have in relation to staff was that some of the front desk staff seem disinterested and blunt, however one girl (unfortunately I forget her name, but she is a young, small Asian lady) was very helpful and a constant pleasure to deal with. The maids always had a room looking great when we returned at night. The breakfast staff were friendly and helpful, and the manager (Philip Tucker) made a point of walking around the breakfast bar each morning asking guests if they had any problems and how their stay was going. What more can you ask for from a mid-range hotel's staff?? There was actually a day during our stay, when the council had a gas supply problem, which in turn meant we had no hot water in the hotel. The manager left a message on the answering machine of every room, apologizing for and explaining the problem and approximate time it would be rectified. He then apologized to the guests again at breakfast the next morning. Some reviews I have read mentioned the noise from ambulances; which is noticeable, however I can't see how this would affect somebodies stay and it is impossible for the hotel to solve this problem. I would recommend booking hotels on the higher floors to combat this problem. For a mid-range hotel, close to Boston center (and close to the hospital) you can't get much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Boston on a budget”
Reviews.Author: merseytripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent option for those on a budget as it has a substantial free buffet breakfast, free airport shuttle and free shuttle to three drop off points in Boston. The rooms are comfortable, however the front of the hotel is on a main road and is noisy. The nearest subway is about 7 blocks away, however we found the shuttles more than covered our needs. The hotel has a diner attached to it (Rudi's) which has good food and is good value. The hotel also provides free coffee, tea, hot chocolate and cookies in the lobby. Despite the noise, I would recommend this hotel and suggest you ask for a room at the rear of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Iffy Service, Questionable Neighbors”
Reviews.Author: JonathanP5
Reviews.Content: While the housekeeping girls were great, the front desk staff were indifferent and had the 'I don't really want to be here, I'd rather be some place else' attitudes. Ask them for assistance and they seemed unsure of their jobs. They boast a "Business Center" but it is really two computers and a fax machine in a hole-in-the -wall closet. The hotel seems to be extremely busy with events going on and travellers coming and going but it is very lacking when it comes to the rooms as well. First, the linens smell like they are partially dried and put up wet and they have a sour odor to them. Then sheets do not fit. It is an every night struggle to get up and put the sheet corners back on the bed. The comforter is anything but comforting! The batting, you know the fluffy stuffing inside, is extremely lumpy and is hideous to look at. Second, the smell of raw sewage that seeps out of the bathroom drain pipes is over-whelming. It permiates everthing! There is a small kitchenette, a microwave and sink that is not bad but the dorm fridge has no freezer section nor can you control the temperature. The 9th floor, where to start? It smelled like the chlorine from the pool and it took over the whole floor. There must have been some kind of leak because there was some really healthy black mold growing along the base of the wall just outside of the pool. The area is conveniently located between Dorchester and Roxbury in easy access of Logan Airport, Mass Pike, I-93 and a shopping plaza. But while I was here I googled Boston Police Departments website and found that there is a halfway/rehabilitation place directly across the street that houses 10 registered SEX offenders, glad I didn't have my kids with me!! The restaurant, they make it appear to be a three star restaurant with bar/sportsbar but the one night I did order from there it was almost inedible. The main course had to have been microwaved because although the outside was very hot the center was ice cold. The garlic bread was rock hard and had some kind of nasty cheesy-parsley topping added to give it more flavor, maybe? The "high-speed" Internet was anything BUT high speed and would kick you off, just because!! Parking is NOT free. It is in the garage across the street for $25/week. The almost constant wailing of ambulance sirens is almost enough to drive someone insane, so good luck sleeping because next to Boston Medical it is an absolute constant sound night and day. Sweet dreams!!

Reviews.Title: “Be Very Careful of this Property”
Reviews.Author: ltullius
Reviews.Content: I checked in for a five-night stay pre-paid for via Priceline.com. When I checked out I was given a zero balance folio. Two days later the property placed a charge on my credit card for $980.00. When I called the manager, Phillip Tucker, he told me they did not participate in Priceline, which is curious considering my stay was booked through that site and I had printed confirmation. Then Mr. Tucker's story changed...actually the property DID accept Priceline bookings, just not as low as the price I had been given. Note that rates are authorized by properties, not Priceline. I'll cut to the chase: I made at least a dozen calls to the property and many to Hilton Guest Services. This situation took two months to resolve with the property finally crediting my card back the $980.00. I have never received an apology from the property. I wrote to the Boston Better Business Bureau who contacted Mr. Tucker two times. He failed to respond in both cases. I also contacted the Massachusetts Attorney General's Office of Consumer Complaints. Again, no response from the property. Decent place to stay, but unless you have many hours available after you check out to spend working out how this property books rooms and records revenue, stay someplace else. If you want a reponsive empathetic manager, again stay someplace else. Hilton Guest Services was barely better.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service - Manager does not respond to questions.”
Reviews.Author: businesschief
Reviews.Content: This review is solely based on the service recieved in the days before arriving at the hotel. The customer service at this hotel is terrible. I have made a booking for my son who is starting graduate school at BUMC and wanted to pay for his room. This required a credit card authorization form. This caused so many issues including the manager Phillip Tucker being unresponsive to my phone calls and messages to him! That is just plain rude! 1) The front desk does not know anything. They kept transferring me to reservations and reservations kept transferring me back to the the front desk. The front desk was who was supposed to send me the form, but the people there were inept. 2) They require that I fax them a copy of my credit card, however I did not feel like doing this because the people are inept and I do not trust them with that information. 3) I wanted to know if my son could bring the form with my card info and copy to the hotel so they transferred me to the manager, Phillip Tucker. 4) I left a message for him at 1 pm on Thurs and again at 12pm on Friday. Today being Saturday. He has yet to respond. For a manager, this is just not done! As of now I have had no response. My son flies in on sunday and I have booked a room in the Marriott South Boston just in case if problems arrise. I have never had a problem with Marriotts and they did not give any issue with the authorization. The Hampton Inn is just more convenient for him and that is why we will try it. If not, we will leave the hotel and go to the marriott. If you are looking for service, I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not so good”
Reviews.Author: flames9
Reviews.Content: Where does one start? I guess it depends on why your visiting Boston. If you are here because you want to be close to the Boston Medical hospital or VA hospital, it is fine as it is a few minute walk to the hospitals. But if your here, like we are for tourist stuff, it is not so great. The hospital does offer a shuttle service to downtown Boston, BUT its not hourly and the 13 seat van fills up quickly. One couple reserved 2 days in advance, and staff forgot to put them on the list,oops. Not sure what they did to make it up to them! It is around a $10 taxi ride from hotel to Fenway park, and $10 from hotel to the Aquarium, or the pond where the Swan boats are, so not too bad. Rooms where clean, tub is very small and had black mildew/mold around some of the caulking!! Free Internet. If you like Ambulance sirens, this is the place for you!! There were long stretches of no sirens, so it wasn't constant, but there were times it became a bit annoying, but I did sleep fine. Parking is $25 a night. Staff are very friendly. Free breakfast consisted of bagels/bread/danishes, fruit, yogurt, cereal, sausages, scrambled eggs, juices, coffee, and they had 1 waffle maker. There is a Dunkin Donuts just across the street, 10 second walk!!! Would I stay here again? If I wanted to be near the hospital, sure, but as a tourist no. I say No because of the infrequent shuttle times and it fills up fast. Another item that sort of ticked us off, was that our room entry cards were constantly becoming non-magnetized, so door would not open and had to go back to the front desk. Have never had this problem before, staff insisted it was because we must have come in contcat with magnets?????

Reviews.Title: “Newer Hotel - Decent Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ScottfromLV
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here in Late July 2010. Didn't spend a lot of time here as we arrived late afternoon and left the following morning. This is a clean, well kept Hampton Inn, located near the hospital and a little ways from the main part of downtown Boston. Saw some complaints earlier about the neighborhood and the noise. I found neither to be as bad as others made it out to be. Granted I was here only 1 night, but anytime you stay in a hotel within a busy city, you have to deal with noise and other people. In fact the morning of my meeting was so nice, I walked the 1.5 miles to their building on Washington St, though I could have easily taken a bus, which has a stop 2 blocks from the hotel. Good parking set up as well for a city based hotel, with the deck right across the street and no valet to bother with. Breakfast was the standard Hampton Inn affair, which has improved in recent years. Only complaint would be that the kitchen area gets a little tight during prime time. I would happily return to this property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Rooms and Compassionate Staff”
Reviews.Author: alpha232
Reviews.Content: I recently had to make an emergency trip to Boston to take a close friend for surgery at Boston Medical Center. The hotel location is PERFECT, only a very short walk to the hospital, and between the hotel shuttle and public transportation, you really make this hotel your home base for any trip to Boston. The breakfast is the usual Hampton offering however the staff make the difference. Being a very busy morning, it was heartening to see the breakfast attendant taking the time to help a family with getting the food for their children. It helped keep the line moving but also showed a caring attitude that I saw reflected in each staff member I encountered during my stay. I hope my next trip to Boston will be under better circumstances, and I will be staying here again. Disclaimer: I am a employee at a different hotel, and as such receive an employee discount. I have no connection with this hotel, it's management, or employees, other than as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Boston's 3 star hotel of best value”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler1688
Reviews.Content: I was a frequent world business traveler from 1998 to 2008. So it's time to consume my frequent traveler's points for FREE vacations. I researched all four chains at Boston for my family vacation: Marriott (Marriott near Boston Harbor, Residence Inn, Courtyard at Tufts Medical Center, etc), Starwood (Sheraton, Westin, W, Four Point at the airport, etc), Hilton (Hilton at financial district, DoubleTree at Tufts Medical center, embassy Suite, 3 of the Hampton Inns, etc), and Hyatt (at the airport). This Hampton Inn offered the best value for my needs. One of the reasons I chose this hotel is that the General Manager Philip Tucker interacted on this TripAdvisor site. So I exchanged emails with him and decided to give it a shot. Pros (clean and best of value): 1. Hand-on friendly management staff (Every morning at the breakfast area, you will see Philip walking around, smiling and asking every guest about their experience, and he's ready to address it on spot.) 2. This is a VERY clean and newer facility throughout. It makes me feel this is almost a Hilton Garden Inn. 3. Free shuttles to airports and downtown tourist spots ( hotel to Prudential, Boston Common, Aquarium, back to hotel) 4. Free breakfast: pretty good for free breakfast. Guess the quality has improved after someone commented at this site in the past and Philip intervened. 5. Fairly convenient to Buses and Ts. This is the reason I chose this Hampton Inn versus the other two). You can get on 1 or CT1 buses and get to the Ts easily (Silver Line to Chinatown, Orange Line to Aquarium/Children Museum, and Green Line to Science center/Galleria/Charles River boat tour). 6. Swimming pool. It's a shallow one 3 1/2 feet. Great for my toddler daughter. Cons: 1. Front desk staff could smile more and be more friendlier compared to other hotels. 2. Shuttle driver wasn't consistently reliable on schedule. I talked to Philip and he started a sign-up sheets for shuttles. Things improved!! 3. Ambulance noise could be bad as the medical center ER is right across the street. Some guests commented previously. But it isn't bad for us at all, and it's just typical busy city noise like the NYC we stayed a week earlier. Recommend you get a higher floor and the opposite end from street. That's what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, a little out of the way comes with shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: wonder-luster
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the hotel. Room's clean, bed's comfortable, internet connection is good and comes with a little kitchenette. Breakfast spread is so-so and breakfast area is rather congested in the morning. As location is a bit out of the way, the hotel provides the complementary hourly shuttle bus that brings you to the waterfront area, where you catch your trains. You can also catch the complementary shuttle to the airport. Nice place. Will definitely return the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not as nice location; staff was helpful, clean room”
Reviews.Author: Seven7777
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on a decent price for a nice room. CONS: The hotel was far away from the train/subway station. It was a decent walk to get anywhere. The hotel is also far away from the main places you might be coming to Boston to see such as the museum, aquarium, market etc. The shuttle took a really long time to get to the airport, and we did call ahead. It was frustrating to watch other hotels' shuttles come and go multiple times while waiting for mine. The room did not have black out curtains. It just has sheer curtains. That may have just been my room, maybe others are different, but I didn't like not being able to close my curtains. PROS: The price was very reasonable for such a nice hotel. It was an upscale place. The hotel was pretty and very clean. The room was spacious and very accomodating. The bed was very comfortable. I usually do not sleep well in hotels and I slept very well here. The front desk staff were very polite. My friend and I got lost a ton, they gave us maps and help in finding certain places which we really appreciate. And if the manager reads this one, I love that you give the maps out, it's such a huge help and very appreciated. Also, my credit card was charged twice on accident for my stay, and upon check out, the lady at the front desk handled it quickly with no problems. Summary: I recommend this hotel to anyone who may be in on business etc. The location isn't convenient, but it's a MUCH better price than staying in the middle of everything. Plus, Hampton offers free breakfast whereas most of the others do not.

Reviews.Title: “Location? near enough to what you want to do.”
Reviews.Author: CamilleNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Although the Hampton Inn is not really near any of the Boston attractions, it is near enough for you to take a taxi to get there. The free shuttle doesn't run that often. So factor in a cab ride. The rooms are Hampton Inn wonderful, with a mini fridge and a comfy couch. It pays to be a Hilton Honors member, but all guests can get good coffee in the lobby and cookies. Now, that's a welcome mat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: lem1783
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hampton Inn. It was comfortable, clean, & modern. Staff was friendly. We took the Shuttle around town on a Saturday afternoon, and it was fine. Breakfast the next morning was not great, but I was hungover & hungry, so it worked for me. There is a little store that is open all night for snacks. It is not a super convenient location if you are taking public transportation, though it was easy to get to from the club we went to. Definitely explore the South End if you stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely surprise:))”
Reviews.Author: gautammohta
Reviews.Content: we were staying in this hotel for 4 nights, and i can say that it was a hotel which was a lovely surprise for us. since the facilities are new, so everything about the hotel looks very fresh and clean. the hotel staff were very friendly, and extremely helpful. at $179 a night, it was a very well priced hotel. the hotel is just a mile n a half from the down town area, so they do have free pick ups and drops at regular intervals to various points in the city centre, and also free airport drop facilities, which was very nice and convenient even at a very early hour. thr rooms of the hotel is very spacious, and toilets very clean. the lobby area is very lively and complimentarty coffee, tea and hot chocolates and even light snacks avalable all day long. the highway outside, could be a lil noisy , in the nights , with the sirens goin o from time to time. over all it was indeed a very pleasant and comfortable stay and would highly recommend this hotel to fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “An OK stay but there are problems”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Crosstown Center because I had to get to the Beth Israel hospital for a 6 AM check-in for surgery, and their website says "Complimentary, ''hourly'' shuttle service from 5:00AM to 10:45PM is provided from our hotel to Logan Airport and nearby Longwood Medical Area." I even called to confirm this was the case, and was told that yes, the shuttle left at 5 AM for the hospital. But when I arrived, they gave me a schedule that showed the first shuttle ride to the Longwood area leaves at 6:45 AM. My whole reason for selecting the hotel was their shuttle to the hospital, and this was actually not available to me. The fellow at the desk said "why not ask the airport shuttle driver if he can drop you off on his run?" Instead I ended up taking a cab. Other than that, the stay was fine. I was initially given a connecting room (I hate connecting rooms) but when I asked for a change, I was given a non-connecting room without question. The desk staff were friendly (if not particularly helpful re: my shuttle issue). The room was clean and pretty large. The bed was comfortable. Compared to other Hampton's I felt that the room and the hallways were blander and more "cookie cutter" but so what: everything was clean and in good working order. The hotel is next to a hospital and I heard ambulance sirens all night long. It is also in a somewhat seedy feeling area; it did not feel particularly safe after dark. As I said, other than the shuttle description in the web site being inaccurate, the stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: urban_kowboy
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit in Boston and I didn't do a whole lot of research with the hotels and the neighborhoods. I was attracted to the rate and it was a fair cab ride to Fenway Park. I can only compare this to other Hampton Inns. I think some of the negative reviews on here are unfair if you consider that Hampton Inn is not a Ritz Carlton or Grand Hyatt. I thought the rooms were a fair size and most important, they were clean. The pool was closed due to renovations but the Hampton clearly posted that on their corporate web site so it didn't come as a surprise. They offer a free breakfast but don't get to excited, the day I was there, it was cereal, french toast sticks, fruit, toast, and bagels. I think they had biscuits, I forgot. But I've read some reviews here where they had waffles so I guess they weren't serving them that day. My only suggestion to breakfast is to add eggs and to provide a microwave oven because some of the hot stuff cools down after some time. But again, it's free so I'm not going to push that issue. I wasn't crazy about the location since there is a hospital across the street so you will be hearing sirens from outside. One thing I didn't notice was there was this restaurant downstairs that turns into a night club lounge on the weekends. If you are into urban hip hop with r&b, then you will like it. There was a line out there pass midnight but I have to commend the hotel for the fact that such a late night establishment exist on their property and yet, it does not interrrupt the peace both inside or outside. My other commendation goes to the General Manager who was every where greeting guests and offering his assistance. And if you had an issue, he would call you directly to try to resolve it. That's A+ service. The business center was alright. Contrary to a previous review from someone else, there were 2 computers, not 1. But let me tell you what was really good for me; The shuttle van. I called the hotel from the airport and they communicated with the driver that I was waiting. He showed up in a timely manner and it turns out that the shuttle takes guests to some other points of interest around Boston. They have a schedule but maybe if you ask nicely, they could drop you off somewhere outside of their schedule close-by. Don't bank on that idea because I didn't try. I'm just saying that it doesn't hurt to ask. So you can cab it or walk the several blocks to the nearest T stop. If you are here on a short visit like a weekend or for a few days, then you should give this a shot for all the reasons I pointed out. But if you are in Boston for a week vacation with your family, I would spend more money for more space and a better location. That's just me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: Jilbear
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel not knowing much about it other than it was close to the Reggie Lewis Track Center, which was where we were going to be over the weekend. The reviews on TripAdvisor were good so I booked it. Well, we got a great rate, staff couldn't have been nicer and the room was clean and nice. We found out at check in that there were free shuttles all day to the track center so we saved time, money and a hassle not having to park and walk. There was also a hotel shuttle that goes to a few stops in downtown Boston, including Copley Square and the Aquarium. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and will also recommend to the school we are associated with. I think they should use this hotel in the future when traveling to Boston for track events. Oh, also, there is free basic continental breakfast. Perfect when you're on the go.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Boston Medical Center, Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerofNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hampton Inn Crosstown in February for three (3) nights, of which two nights I was alone for business and 3rd night my wife and two kids drove up to visit and see the Boston sights. Check-in was good. Front desk staff helpful, courteous and friendly. Left my laptop computer in their security boxes and my luggage in their offices and I had no problems. Shuttle schedule to main attractions and medical centers, free coffee and cookies available during the day. Free breakfast - best my wife has ever seen in a hotel and w/ two kids we would know! Bacon or sausage, eggs or potatoes, fresh cut fruit and apples/bananas, muffins, bread/bagels/toast, juice and coffee. Nice set-up and staff were there keeping the place clean and filled. VERY GOOD! Free newspaper daily. Rooms were fine. Switched from a king bed room to a 2-queen beds room when my family arrived mid-stay. Typical set-up, very clean though in room and bathroom. Choice of pillows. Not much drawer space if you have an extended stay. Parking garage across the driveway - keyed access to your room key. Seemed like a safe garage, well lit, high fences. Pool and gym on 9th floor - small side, one piece of each equipment so the times I visited they were occupied so I stopped trying. Hotel located conveniently to Boston Medical Center, but not near subway line or any tourist attractions. Nicely updated building and surroundings - next door is a Dunkin Donuts and Quiznos. Down the street is McDonald's and other restaurants, CVS around the corner - but I would not walk there late at night - very busy thoroughfares and panhandlers looking for change. Sports Bar/restaurant on premises - dark interior, large bar and televisions. Menu is full and choices seem fine. Given that I had no vehicle, I ate several meals here until family arrived in car. Lunch/dinner choices were fine - salads, burgers, wraps, more dinner entrees available. Other diners there besides hotel guests. I would prefer a standard restaurant w/ a separate bar, but this serves the purposes. Overall great stay, no negative points - other than the location and not many dining choices besides fast food.

Reviews.Title: “Accused of stealing pillows!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chlemos
Reviews.Content: Without notifying us, this hotel charged us $75 for 2 missing pillows. When asked to speak to a manager, our first message was never returned. On a second phone call the manager threatned us verbally, which is definatelly NOT a business like manner of handling a guest complaint .

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Mainiac1950
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just spent a long weekend at this Hampton Inn. I chose it based on cost and reviews. It is clean, moderately attractive, very comfortable and inexpensive. Excellent shuttle service. Best of all is the wonderful staff who could not have been nicer or more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average- good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SoCal-MJ
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I've stayed at the Crosstown Hamptons- and yes I'll probably be back again next year. The location is a bit away from T stops- but this is made up for by the in-town shuttles that will drop you off conveniently near tourist sites and T stops. The first come-first served on board the shuttle left some that were late coming down waiting for the next one along. The airport pickup also saves time and taxi, T, airport shuttle or water taxi scrambling. The hotel used to have a direct phone at one of the airport sites- I did not find one this time, but through Hotels.com had their number with me. The staff is attentive, they arranged early check-in for us. The manager visits with guests at breakfast to insure the visit is going well. The complimentary breakfast is good, better than most. The variety for the number of guests is pretty good. There should be a microwave available to warm cold waffles. It may be a little noisy for people not used to city noises- there's a hospital across the street- with ambulances arriving with sirens going. Our room was clean, complimentary coffee available in room. Our room had no refrigerator or microwave. True, it's not the Four Seasons, but it's better than the Days Inn I used the first time out there four years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NolanCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the rooms, very spacious and clean. Comes with business center and free shuttle. I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Longwood medical campus/Children's hospital Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to visit”
Reviews.Author: srcesq
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a college visit. Typical Hampton Inn no surprise there. My only issue was that after a day of touring colleges in Boston, we returned to our room at about 2:45 p.m. and the room was not cleaned. A call to the desk got a rude response form the person workling the desk. The assistant manager apologized and tried to make it right. The hotel is not near any of the T hubs, so navigating the cityis a little difficult and their shuttle runs too infrequently. Also fee for parking is too much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: mandyleighLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton with my mother and sister during our trip to Boston. Have nothing but good things to say!! To break it down into categories: ROOMS -- our first 3 nights we were upgraded to a jr king suite....probably didn't hurt that we were using reward points to stay and are diamond members. King size bed was very comfy and queen size sofa bed was suitable. Very nice room. Last night of our stay (after returning from a road trip) we were in a regular room with 2 queen beds. These beds weren't the most comfortable things...but they served the purpose. Both rooms were extremely clean - including bathrooms. Even though the hotel is located across from a major hospital - there was little noise from sirens. Breakfast -- complimentary breakfast bar had anything you could want - and it's free...don't complain! We were greeted by the manager of the hotel every morning...very impressed. Shuttle -- they do offer a free shuttle service to/from airport and to various locations throughout the city. Drivers are very knowledgeable about the area and very friendly. Highly recommend. Location -- unlike other locations, you will not be able to walk to major attractions. Shuttle services and taxis are readily avaliable. Overall great stay - highly recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel offering good value and many extra services”
Reviews.Author: muletrains
Reviews.Content: We searched far and wide to find a suitable hotel in Boston (an expensive city) for the night of the ballgame that would not cost a fortune and we were very lucky to come across the Hampton Inn & Suites on Massachusetts Ave. We booked a Junior Suite with King bed, double sofa bed and kitchenette for $169 plus tax which was very reasonable given the ballgame. The room was large and very clean with a good sized bathroom, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. A free hotel shuttle took us to Fenway Park for the game although we got a taxi back . A very good hot complimentary breakfast was offered with a wide range of choices. After a swim in the 9th floor pool with great views, we took the hotel shuttle to Boston waterfront for lunch then back on the shuttle to collect our cases before getting another hotel shuttle (and complimentary cookies) to the airport for our flight home. The staff were all very courteous and the general manager was very prominent always helping guests with luggage etc ! We could not have asked for more and would certainly choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great amenities.”
Reviews.Author: WQF238
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn at Crosstown Center in Boston is located outside the downtown and Back Bay areas of town, but the value is exceptional when compared to those areas. Adjacent to the Boston Medical Center, Boston FD Headquarters, Boston EMS training facility and just up the road from Southbay Center and Newmarket Square, this hotel has its own local advantages. The hotel is a 9-floor stand alone building connected to a office building with which it shares a parking garage. (Parking is $25 daily with in and out access) There is a Dunkin Donuts, day spa and Quizno's on property, and another restaurant on the first floor which has changed names. The entry area is ample in size and has several luggage carts available. Cookies are usually offered at check-in, however they were gone on our visit. A small â€œSuite Shopâ€� is provided, offering vending machine quality snacks and sundries at the front desk. The Business Center consists of one computer, one printer and a calculator, and is adjacent to the meeting room. A common area is adjacent to the complimentary â€œexpanded continentalâ€� breakfast area. The breakfast is standard Hampton Inn fare, nothing worth mentioning except that it is there and included in the room rate. Our room was on the 9th floor with a king bed and sleeper-sofa for the kids. A desk with two chairs, refrigerator, microwave and bar-sized sink are provided. The bathroom has standard amenities and ample hot water with acceptable water pressure. The pool is located on the 9th floor and is small, but sufficient for a city hotel. A small workout room is adjacent to the pool, and plenty of pool towels are available. This is our third stay at this hotel. The rooms are large, clean and well organized. The staff are kind and helpful and there is a limited shuttle that stops at several of the downtown areas plus a Longwood Medical shuttle to the hospitals.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Boston Gen Hosp Area Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maerose
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nts over July 4th wknd w/husband and friends, whose married daughter (on staff at BG) booked our rooms. Good basic 3 star hotel on Mass Av, South End, walk to BG. Chk in/chk out efficient. Clean fair size room, gd king bed, tv w/hbo, a/c, std tub/shower, some toiletries. Complim. buffet brkfst 6 to 10AM. Vending machines. Shuttle serv. Pkg garage chgs guests $25/nt. 2 Computers in Bus Ctr. Sm fridge provided on request.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: alkrav
Reviews.Content: This will be my last time in a Hampton. This room is supposed to be a "suite" but it is only a few feet bigger than their extremely small rooms. The room does not have any curtains other than sheers and with the high rise offices across the street there is no privacy or darkness for good sleeping. If you care the shuttle drivers are great, if you tip good, and for a favor they will take you anywhere you want to go. I have to say the bar is good and the staff friendly. Happy hour appetizers are well worth the money but the drinks are pricey. Make sure you bring your glasses to review your bill. This room has a bathroom sink that takes a half hour to drain, complaining does no good as there is no night maintenance staff. Or that is what I was told. For a few extra dollars I could have found something better I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nskyline
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night on business. Overall it was very nice and neat looking. The only thing that I found really wrong was I found a curly hair on my blanket (not sheets). I would stay here again since the rooms were very spacious and nice looking. The bathrooms were nice and the shuttle service was a very nice addition!! The shuttle itself saved me lots of money and the drivers were helpful! Rudy's restaurant (attached to the hotel) had some of the best tasting chicken I can recently remember! (it was roasted chicken on a bed of rice with beans; I cannot remember the exact name of the dish.) Pretty good service there too. I would recommend this place to ppl interviewing at BU College of Dental Medicine since it is within walking distance (there was one other guy I met at the school that was staying there too). I would stay again bc of the overall niceness/cleanliness of the place and the airport shuttle service!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ELEANORSDAD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early March (during a snowstorm). The hotel is incredibly clean, the staff was very friendly. The rooms are plush and comfortable. I took the shuttle three times: what a great service!. Both of their drivers are just great; courteous, helpful and friendly. Another bonus was the free breakfast. I cannot believe anyone would complain about a free shuttle. Get out and hail a cab you tightwad!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: dolph99
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, with shuttle to and from the airport, friendly staff, clean rooms. Within walking distance to Boston U. Medical Center, which was great. Highly recommended if you're coming to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean hotel....I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ABLDWL
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a hospital procedure so we decided to stay here because we have always liked Hampton Inn's and it offered a free shuttle to the hospital, airport, attractions, and free breakfast. We have visited Boston six different occasions for hospital stays and have stayed at most of the hotels near the Longwood Hospital district. This was by far the BEST hotel in the Longwood Hospital district for the money. The room was very clean and spacious (we had a junior suite). The breakfast was great and saved us a bunch of money. The free cookies, hot chocolate and coffee are a nice touch to end your day. They even have a little area where you can buy soup, frozen dinners, snacks, etc. The hotel is not that close to many restaurants (there is a Dunkin Donuts, McDonalds, and a pizza place within walking distance), however, just ask the front desk for delivery menus (there are many restaurants that will deliver). We ordered some Chinese food and it was brought to our door within 15 minutes....WOW! We used the shutte serivce many times and it saved us a load of money by not having pay for a cab. Gregory and True-See are the best drivers, they will go out of their way to help you and take you were you would like to go, they were very kind. However, the other drivers are only so-so. We would highly recommend this hotel and we will stay again! Just a personal side note, if you like seafood you need to go to the Atlantic Fish Company on Boylston St, it was delcious!

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment suites, so-so location”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-ExPat
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn at Crossroads is located adjacent to the Boston Medical Center and is a convenient place to stay for patients and their families who need short or extended lodgings. It is connected to the rest of the city by shuttle bus service but is in a fairly vacant neighborhood otherwise and is probably not very useful as a base for exploring the tourist areas. The staff is very helpful about supplying maps and directions, though, so if you have a car there is no issue with finding nearby spots to eat or shop. Parking is located on the bottom level of an enclosed garage next to the hotel: be sure to get a garage pass first from the hotel and do not take the paper ticket on entry (you can't get out without explanation and phone calls to verify you are a guest). The lobby staff is quick and very helpful, there are elevators up to the rooms.
