I opted for a room with kitchenette, and it was very good: spacious and clean, with a usable kitchen area, sitting area for the television, and large king bed. The bed was firm and comfortable, and the room had extensive cable television, wireless internet, and in-room coffee. The bathroom was large and the shower / tub had good hot water and pressure. The hotel serves breakfast in the lobby: it's a bit downscale consisting of pastries, pancakes, cereals, some mysterious eggs and bacon, and fruits. It tends to be fast and crowded in the mornings as people are rushing off to business and appointments: the lobby staff offers box breakfasts as an alternative. The daily papers are also available. I thought that this was a good facility for it's access to the medical center, and the rooms were like studio apartments without having to upgrade to a suite. Pricing was reasonable and the staff was consistently helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Those Going To Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: stevienixfanmike
Reviews.Content: Whenever I have tickets to see the Boston Red Sox play, I typically stay at this property. It is located just six blocks from the Orange Line, which makes it very convenient getting to and from Fenway Park. As usual, I was happy that the front desk agent recognized me and greeted me with a "Welcome Back!" She allowed me to check-in a couple hours early. I work the overnight shift and wanted to get some sleep before the Red Sox game. I am not a smoker, but had to book a smoking room as it was the only room type available. The front desk agent offered to send up an ionizer if the room had an unpleasant smokey odor. When I entered the room, I was pleased that I could not smell any smoke. I did not need the ionizer. The room attendant really cleaned the room well and made it fresh-smelling. As always, I was very pleased with the hotel and the people who work there. The location is ideal for people attending a baseball game or concert at Fenway Park. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a bad part of town”
Reviews.Author: ddmccutch
Reviews.Content: I guess when you look to spend less than $200 in Boston, you should expect to make some sacrifices in your accommodations. However, this hotel is very new, and is the anchor of a small shopping center near the Roxbury/Newmarket (Industrial) section of Boston. It is close to downtown, but it is still a 2 mile drive, as well as being close to the Longwood Medical area. Parking is in an adjacent garage, and costs $25 a night. I had a rental vehicle that someone attempted to break into my first night there (left paint damage/dents). The hotel is directly behind (south side) Boston Medical (city hospital), so expect sirens every several minutes all night/morning long. I was later advised by several people not to walk around the area at night, though I did with little trouble, you certainly would be best to walk in groups, and I wouldn't take children with you. The staff was adequately courteous, but the security guard inside the lobby was a little disarming. The rooms are typical of a new Hampton; clean and serving my basic needs. The breakfast is also typical Hampton, with a very large dining room area, so you shouldn't have to fight for a seat as you might at other Hampton properties. Ultimately, if you want to order food in, and are looking for a new hotel that is inexpensive, and sightseeing is not in your plans, this hotel may fit the bill. I would suggest a taxi vs. having a vehicle at this site.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - very clean with nice big comfy beds. On arrival given juice and biscuits. Complimentary breakfast included which offers excellent choice. Very nice staff. Nice restaurant within hotel Joe & Maria's offering anything from sandwiches to steaks etc. The only negative point is it is a bit far out of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, relatively new, good food, but remote location.”
Reviews.Author: BorisYeltsin
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two teenagers for 4 nights. We had a room with 2 double beds on the ninth floor across from the pool. The hotel is relatively new, located on the south west side of the city. Somewhat remote, but the hotel does provide local and airport courtesy buses, running every 1-2 hours. This more than offset the remote location. Note that the nearest subway station(Mass. Ave.) was six blocks or a 15mins. walk away. The breakfast area was always busy, and some days we had difficulty finding a table for four. However the food was excellent, particularly the fruit cocktail bowl. The bedroom was large enough for us and clean. It faced onto the back of the hotel. Note that the front faces onto to some major roads. The pool was small but open from 7am or so until 11pm, with an adjoining fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: My2boys2
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for the money. We were in town to go to the Childrens Hospital and it was perfect for that. They have shuttles for the hospitals, airport, and 3 other locations in the main part of the city. It was clean and well kept. The shuttle drivers were really nice and had a lot of information for any questions you have about the area. The area where the hotel is was not the best but they had a security guard inside the hotel. We made the mistake of walking to the hotel from further down Massachusets Ave. I would NOT recommend that. I would have taken a cab if we knew the area. I would suggest this hotel if you are going to the hospitals but as far as staying there and touring the city I would have chose another hotel closer to downtown. As the previous reviews stated there is a helicopter landing pad next to the hotel but where our room was we did not hear that. The worst part for us was the curtains on the windows in the room do not close so for us when the sun came up we were up too. When I booked it, it said everything was 2-3 miles away and I thought that would not be a problem. It is far from everything you want to do. If you take the shuttles there is a lot of waiting and the cabs are at least $10 each way. But the hotel is a reasonable price. You have a great breakfast in the morning with sausage, fruit, french toast sticks, eggs, muffins, bagels, and cereals. My advice is just to weigh the choices. We had a good experience at this hotel and we wanted a good price and a clean hotel to sleep at night and I think we got that.

Reviews.Title: “Worst location ever”
Reviews.Author: JakeToronto
Reviews.Content: Does this say it all,the only place to eat is a sub place. You have to make your order through bullet proof glass.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel area not great”
Reviews.Author: Tripping999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in a desirable area. Being across from a hospital, there were ambulance sirens frequently. Also, there were homeless people walking up to cars with cups in hand, asking for change. The only food places immediately across from the hotel were a Dunkin Donuts and Quizno's. The hotel room was clean but there was no on-site restaurant and the food available from the concession area in the lobby was very limited and they did not sell alcohol. There was a complimentary airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “It works”
Reviews.Author: HappyParrot1
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for one night on business and picked this Hampton Inn and Suites based on price and location (it was quite cheap compared to others!). The hotel is nothing special, but is clean. Basic little snack area to get a late frozen dinner or random snack. They were quick at the front desk with check-in and had me on my way. My only complaint is that they don't have taxi's at the ready. I'm used to walking out of a hotel in the morning and getting a cab to the office. Instead, I had to walk back in after wandering around and not finding a taxi or a doorman and ask them to call me a cab. The wait wasn't long, but I would say it is geared more to the family guest than the business guest. Overall, not bad for the money and I'd stay again if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: jkim3880
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this Hampton 11 months prior to my arrival because I knew that Boston would be booked during graduation season. Despite this planning ahead to ensure I would have a room, Hampton overbooked their hotel during my stay and bumped me from Crosstown to Peabody. They only notified me of this 1 day prior to my arrival. They said that they had made a mistake with my reservation and that these mistakes do happen and they are not held accountable for rearrangements to the customer's satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok but loved the nearby Chinese Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MelInBillerica
Reviews.Content: I had some friends stay in this hotel when they came up to Boston to visit me. I picked the hotel because of the price and the downtown location. The actual hotel was ok, with decent service. The best part was this new Chinese restaurant that's just a couple of blocks away. We walked over for Dim Sum on Saturday morning and it was delicious!! The restaurant is called Pacific Restaurant and is located at 23 Bradston Street. If you stay at this hotel, make sure to try this place!

Reviews.Title: “Tries Hard, Falls Short”
Reviews.Author: farmview
Reviews.Content: This was one of several hotels listed for a conference that I attended in March 2008. Given that it was at least $100 less than most of the conference hotels and the conference was offering a shuttle to the Convention Center, I stayed at the Hampton Inn. I drove to the hotel and ended up driving right by it the first time. Crossroads is right -- it is sitting right in the middle of busy Massachusetts Ave and Albany Street -- and I drove right by when I got to the intersection because the writing is very, very tiny near the Albany Street door. Had I been traveling streets away, I would have seen the glow of "Hampton Inn" from the top of the hotel... but that was not the case. After figuring out that I must have missed it, I managed to get myself to the intersection and find the entrance (which is opposite the Albany Street entrance). The parking garage is located across from the hotel on a small side street. It is a commuter lot, but you can park for $25 a night via the hotel. The hotel is located near BU Medical Center, which is not the type of area that you can get out and walk around safely at night (plus there really isn't anything around). So you are a bit isolated. I kept my car parked but took the conference shuttle, hotel shuttle, or cab. The hotel itself is designed as a boutique hotel. I'm not sure what it was before, but there are little touches that indicate they they are trying to be a bit chic (i.e. black and white photographs with catchy sayings). Check-in went fine, but I realized afterwards that my request for a "quiet room" was not granted since I was given a 3rd floor room facing the street. I didn't realize this until later at night and by the time I asked to be relocated the next day, all the rooms were full. I was disappointed in my room initially, but I can say that they really, really do try to make it a nice hotel. The bed was great, the workspace and free wi-fi were great, the microwave, fridge, and little kitchenette space were great. Aside from the street noise, I ended up liking my room by the third day. Breakfast was not very good relative to hot items or breads, but I was glad for the coffee, fresh fruit, and yogurt options. As mentioned above, the hotel offers a complimentary shuttle which goes to the waterfront, the Prudential Center, and Boston Common. The driver who works the 2-10 shift was great. He really enjoys his job and looks out for his customers. He's a real honest, hardworking guy... and he'll go out of his way (between scheduled times) to pick up guests. I can honestly say that I will probably not stay at this Hampton Inn again, but it would be more due to the location than the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: HaarlemTheNeterlands
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hamptons Inn & Suites and had a terrible experience. The staff was extremely unfriendly, the room wasn't cleaned for a couple of days and the breakfast was just horrific. We are used to travel quite a lot internationally and are really not too picky or particular about places to stay. It really ruined our stay in Boston. We had informed the manager of our complaints. There wasn't any respons until the day that we checked out. It seemed to be that the staff is rather discriminating.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: OnionOrion
Reviews.Content: A southerner, I went to Boston in January to investigate possible medical treatment at Dana-Farber. From the price, I expected I'd be staying at a big-city hotel with muffins or donuts and coffee for breakfast and few amenities. Instead, I found an attractively modern, comfortable hotel, with courteous and prompt no-cost shuttle service to and from the hospital and airport, and a full, hot breakfast available, at no cost, in the morning. A couple of local restaurants delivered reasonably priced dinners that didn't taste like fast food. Staff were pleasant and helpful. A pool and exercise equipment were available (alas, I left my bathing suit at home), as were rental movies and wifi connection. My only regret was not having time to get to the Fine Arts Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Irene J
Reviews.Content: Too bad this hotel is so far away. Shuttle makes it do-able. I would stay here again. Of course staying in town would be better, but price was about $140/night cheaper. Good shuttle personel from airport to all the other places to visit or eat,Pickup every hour. Few times we were too late for the shuttle. It was a $13 cab ride from Quincy Market to hotel. Great bedding.,

Reviews.Title: “Grear Value”
Reviews.Author: BLynnS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in September 2007 in a king suite. While not large, the room was pleasant and clean with a refrigerator and microwave. The wireless worked well the entire visit. The included breakfast was OK to good, depending on the choices and saved us money and time. The shuttle was great; we used it both for airport transportation and to access the downtown area. The shuttle even took us to the JFK Museaum one morning (also great). The front desk staff were very accomodating. The pool on the 9th floor was very nice. Given the price of Boston's hotels, this one is a good value. My two complaints are 1. the location is away from any attractions/shopping/restaurants (need to use the shuttle or cab) and 2. no safe in the rooms. I would definitely stay here again if needing budget aoomodations in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annabelle1116
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn Crosstown is a very nice hotel. I would have given it a 5 rating except for the fact of its location. It is in a bad area of town and unless you have transportation accessibility, it's not a safe area. As for the hotel, it is a very clean, well-maintained facility with friendly and helpful staff. The buffet breakfast was a plus and the manager of the hotel mingled with the guests during breakfast, which I thought was good public relations. There is a Boston tour that comes to the hotel and picks you up. That was a real convenience. The hotel also provides a free shuttle to and from the airport. We did wait for the shuttle almost an hour, but that's to be expected in Boston. Another guest staying at the hotel told me that the shuttle never came, maybe because they didn't realize that it could be a long wait, so they took a cab to the hotel and the hotel was gracious enough to pay the cab fare. There is also a hotel shuttle that takes you to a few local destinations. I didn't take advantage of the service, but one person I spoke to said the service was very helpful. The hotel recommends that you do not depend on the shuttle for your total transportation. We were in town for a convention so it had it's own shuttle to and from the convention. My overall experience at this hotel was very pleasant and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: emperorsclothes
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a stay at the Hampton Inn in Boston (Mass Ave) and I did something I had never done before. I sent a thank you card to the staff telling them how great they had made our stay. We came in on the red-eye flight and the shuttle was there as soon as we got our baggage. Ramon at the front desk let us check in early so we could catch a nap. Anthony and Bobby the shuttle drivers were fantantic and kept us laughing everywhere they took us. Everyone on the staff has a great attitude. The beds and the pillows were better than home. The girl at the desk (Elvira?) was so nice about keeping our bags for us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Trust me after the dump we stayed in in Manhattan (Hotel Pennsylvania for twice the price) I would stay at the Hampton Inn in a heartbeat! I have stayed in hotels all over the world and never had such nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Womblebeak
Reviews.Content: Location is the problem here. Didn't feel safe to walk outside but the front desk got cabs with ease. Very noisy outside, double glazing would help. Room excellent, staff excellent, facilities excellent, restaurant/bar excellent, reasonably priced, shuttle to airport excellent. If it were somewhere else it would get a 5!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: RiniPDX
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hampton Inns very frequently. This one was clean & comfortable. However, the area makes it unattractive (not much in walking distance and not really an area you'd want to walk around in) and there were no laundry facilities (which are generally quite common at Hamptons). The noise from the hospital and the highway are a bit noticeable, but not terrible- I slept fine. The price is decent, but as far as a hotel in the Boston area, you can definitely do better if you want to be in the center of the city and there are lots of excellent low cost options a bit further out. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CollegeGirly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It was very nice, with comfy bed and clean rooms. Even though the hotel is on the outside of the city center, it was only a few blocks away from the subway station and the bus stop was right out the front door of the hotel. The shuttle drivers were nice for the most part, but if you don't tip them, don't expect them to come back for you. Other than that the hotel was great for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: csharp99
Reviews.Content: I booked this for a business visit since the rate was good and the location seemed ok. After I informed my contact where I booked they were quite alarmed since the neighborhood apparently is not too friendly, but I must say I haven't really had any trouble. The rooms are good and clean, although the walls are a bit thin. Sounds carry over easily from other rooms, especially through the ventilation system. Another major contributor to the noise is the proximity of the hospital which is just around the corner, with ambulances going by very regularly. Nothing too bad though. The complimentary wireless internet access is definitely a plus. Speed is decent and it's very reliable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I haven't tried the shuttle services, so I can't comment on it. The location is not too good if you want to have quick access to a good restaurant, bar or theatre. There is a Ground Round bar adjacent to the hotel which is pretty decent but will gett a little boring if you need to spend more than two nights in a row there. So getting a taxi into the city center seems to be the only option. The breakfast is reasonable although a little one-sided (sugar) and all in all I have to say I'm pretty pleased with the hotel. So if you're looking for a decent hotel for a reasonable price, and you don't take too much notice of the ambulances rushing past every now and then, this might be one to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: MimiScotland
Reviews.Content: Great friendly service, very clean, shuttle service to city centre every half hour was very useful. Wonderful facilities. Surprisingly cheap.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn & Suites Boston Crosstown Center
HotelInfo.Address: 811 Massachusetts Avenue, Boston, MA 02118
